title: Bindi Irwin reveals she will walk down the aisle with a koala
text:
Bindi Irwin is in full swing planning her 2020 wedding to American wakeboarder Chandler Powell.

And now the wildlife warrior, 21, has revealed she will walk down the aisle with not only her brother Robert, 15 - but also with a furry friend.

In an interview with Good Morning America, on Friday, the brunette beauty said: 'I'm not sure how many people have walked down the aisle with a koala.

'We may be setting some new trends for weddings!' Bindi Irwin reveals that in addition to being walked down the aisle by her younger brother Robert, 15, she will also be accompanied by a koala

'But we may be setting some new trends for weddings from here on out!'

During the interview, her fiancé Chandler also revealed Bindi has been diligent and organised with planning nuptials, comparing her to the Parks and Recreation character, Leslie Knope (played by Amy Poehler).

'Bindi is 100 per cent Leslie Knope, she has colour-coded binders. She has itineraries for all of us. It makes my job easy!' Chandler joked.

Setting a wedding trend: In an interview with Good Morning America on Friday, the brunette beauty said: 'I'm not sure how many people have walked down the aisle with a koala'

Back in July, Bindi told Entertainment Tonight: 'I think that for me, it'll be really important that Robert walks me down the aisle. That's something that I really want to do.

'I'm always so grateful that Robert is there, and he has been such a big part of my life and he's always stepped up and been the one to give me a hug when I need it and encourage me forward in life.

'So he will definitely be the one to walk me down the aisle when the time comes, and I think that will make it really special.

'And I think that's what dad would have wanted as well.'

'I think that's what dad would have wanted': Back in July, Bindi told Entertainment Tonight : 'I think that for me, it'll be really important that Robert walks me down the aisle. That's something that I really want to do'

The animal advocate said goodbye to her late father, 'Crocodile Hunter' Steve Irwin, back in 2006, after a tragic accident.

Bindi was just eight-years-old when Steve died after a stingray barb pierced his chest in 2006.

Bindi, Robert, and Terri Irwin focused their personal missions on keeping Steve's legacy intact and continuing his animal conservation efforts.

Chandler proposed to Bindi back in July.

authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
